column14: Indicates an exception or condition.
Land that is too poor to produce vegetation.
A settlement of improvised housing, usually in poor conditions.
Something that prevents progress or action.
A software application that runs automated tasks on the internet.
To drop or descend due to gravity.
A place where the dead are buried.
A black bird that feeds on dead animals.
A bird belonging to the crow family, including crows, ravens, and magpies.
The rear part of the body; also, the end of something.
Facts, figures, or information collected for analysis.
A medium of exchange in the form of coins, banknotes, or digital currency.
Indicates necessity or obligation.
A copy that is exactly like the original.
Referring to two things or people together.
A former spouse or partner.
To not succeed in achieving a goal or result.
Up to the point in time or event mentioned.
Flowers in full blossom.
To produce flowers or come into full beauty.
The lowest part of something.
Places, people, or documents that provide information.
A kitchen appliance used for baking or roasting food.
A black-and-white bird known for its intelligence and attraction to shiny objects.
A brightly colored bird, often blue, in the crow family.
A type of bird, also known as a red-billed chough.
A spell or curse, usually associated with magic or superstition.
To unexpectedly meet or come across someone or something.
Not frequently occurring; unusual.
Restricted in size, amount, or extent.
Used to introduce a contrast or exception.
A unit of time equal to 60 seconds.
Not easy to understand or see.
Contraction of "cannot," indicating inability or prohibition.
To observe or record something in writing.
The act of passing something from one person or process to another.
To bend something over onto itself.
At a greater distance or to a greater extent.
At a more distant point or location.
A small, round object used for fastening clothes or operating a device.
Used to introduce a clause giving more information about something.
A small yellow wildflower.
To risk something on the outcome of an event.
No more than; solely.
Replaced or erased by writing over it.
A person, often a woman, believed to have magical powers.
A large, black bird related to crows, common in Europe and Asia.
A system of ideas intended to explain something.
A stone marker placed over a grave.
A burial place in the ground.
A written record of a meeting’s proceedings.
An online encyclopedia where users contribute and edit content.
Used to specify a particular person, place, or thing.
Different or distinct from one already mentioned or known.
